tool.name: parallel beta diversity
tool.command:
uncompress_tgz.py -i $input_path -o parallel_beta_diversity_input; parallel_beta_diversity.py -i parallel_beta_diversity_input -o parallel_beta_diversity_output #if str($metrics) != 'None': -m $metrics #end if
#if str($tree_path) != 'None': -t $tree_path #end if
#if $retain_temp_files: -R #end if
#if $poll_directly: -T #end if
#if $suppress_polling: -W #end if
#if str($job_prefix): -X $job_prefix #end if
#if $seconds_to_sleep: -Z $seconds_to_sleep #end if
#if $jobs_to_start: -O $jobs_to_start #end if
#if $full_tree: -f #end if ; compress_path.py -i parallel_beta_diversity_output -o $output_path

param.label: -m/--metrics: Beta-diversity metric(s) to use. A comma-separated list should be provided when multiple metrics are specified. [default: unweighted_unifrac,weighted_unifrac]
param.name: metrics

param.label: -t/--tree_path: path to newick tree file, required for phylogenetic metrics [default: None]
param.name: tree_path

param.label: -R/--retain_temp_files: retain temporary files after runs complete (useful for debugging) [default: False]
param.name: retain_temp_files

param.label: -T/--poll_directly: Poll directly for job completion rather than running poller as a separate job. If -T is specified this script will not return until all jobs have completed. [default: False]
param.name: poll_directly

param.label: -W/--suppress_polling: suppress polling of jobs and merging of results upon completion [default: False]
param.name: suppress_polling

param.label: -X/--job_prefix: job prefix [default: descriptive prefix + random chars]
param.name: job_prefix

param.label: -Z/--seconds_to_sleep: Number of seconds to sleep between checks for run completion when polling runs [default: 60]
param.name: seconds_to_sleep

param.label: -f/--full_tree: By default, each job removes calls _fast_unifrac_setup to remove unused parts of the tree. pass -f if you already have a minimal tree, and this script will run faster
param.name: full_tree

tool.help: This script performs like the beta_diversity.py script, but is intended to make use of multicore/multiprocessor environments to perform analyses in parallel. The output of %prog is a folder containing text files, each a distance matrix between samples.
